Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.auth

Class DMARCValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.auth.DMARCValidator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DKIMCallback, SPFCallback
    public class DMARCValidator
extends java.lang.Object
implements SPFCallback, DKIMCallback
    DMARC (Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance) validator as defined in RFC 7489.

    DMARC combines SPF and DKIM authentication results with domain alignment checks to determine whether a message should be accepted, quarantined, or rejected. This implementation is fully asynchronous and event-driven.

    This class implements both SPFCallback and DKIMCallback, allowing it to aggregate results from both validators. When the DKIM result arrives (always last, after end-of-data), DMARC evaluation is triggered automatically and the registered DMARCCallback is invoked.

    DMARC alignment requires that:

    • SPF passes AND the envelope domain aligns with the From domain, OR
    • DKIM passes AND the signing domain aligns with the From domain

    Event-driven usage (recommended): 

    
 DNSResolver resolver = new DNSResolver();
 resolver.useSystemResolvers();
 resolver.open();

 DMARCValidator dmarc = new DMARCValidator(resolver, dmarcCallback);

 // Wire up SPF validator to report to DMARC
 spfValidator.check(sender, clientIP, heloHost, dmarc);

 // Set From domain when parsed from message headers
 // (typically via DMARCMessageHandler)
 dmarc.setFromDomain("example.com");

 // Wire up DKIM validator to report to DMARC
 // When dkimResult() is called, DMARC evaluates and calls dmarcCallback
 dkimValidator.verify(dmarc);

    Direct usage (for testing or manual orchestration): 

    
 dmarc.evaluate("example.com", SPFResult.PASS, "example.com",
     DKIMResult.PASS, "example.com", callback);
    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    RFC 7489 - DMARC, DMARCMessageHandler

    • Constructor Detail

      • DMARCValidator

        public DMARCValidator​(DNSResolver resolver)
        Creates a new DMARC validator using the specified DNS resolver.

        Use this constructor for direct/manual evaluation via evaluate(String, SPFResult, String, DKIMResult, String, DMARCCallback).

        Parameters:
        resolver - the DNS resolver to use for policy lookups

      • DMARCValidator

        public DMARCValidator​(DNSResolver resolver,
                      DMARCCallback callback)
        Creates a new DMARC validator for event-driven usage.

        This validator will implement SPFCallback and DKIMCallback, accumulating results. When dkimResult(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.auth.DKIMResult, java.lang.String, java.lang.String) is called, DMARC evaluation triggers automatically.

        Parameters:
        resolver - the DNS resolver to use for policy lookups
        callback - the callback to receive DMARC results

    • Method Detail

      • spfResult

        public void spfResult​(SPFResult result,
                      java.lang.String explanation)
        Receives the SPF result.

        Called by SPFValidator when SPF check completes. The result is stored for later DMARC evaluation.

        Specified by:
        spfResult in interface SPFCallback
        Parameters:
        result - the SPF result
        explanation - optional explanation (for FAIL results)

      • setSpfDomain

        public void setSpfDomain​(java.lang.String domain)
        Sets the SPF domain (envelope sender domain).

        This should be called at the same time as SPF check is initiated, since the domain is known at MAIL FROM time.

        Parameters:
        domain - the envelope sender domain

      • setFromDomain

        public void setFromDomain​(java.lang.String domain)
        Sets the RFC5322.From domain.

        This is typically called by DMARCMessageHandler when the From header is parsed.

        Parameters:
        domain - the From header domain

      • dkimResult

        public void dkimResult​(DKIMResult result,
                       java.lang.String signingDomain,
                       java.lang.String selector)
        Receives the DKIM result and triggers DMARC evaluation.

        Called by DKIMValidator when DKIM verification completes. Since DKIM is always the last result (at end-of-data), this triggers DMARC evaluation with all accumulated state.

        Specified by:
        dkimResult in interface DKIMCallback
        Parameters:
        result - the DKIM result
        signingDomain - the DKIM signing domain (d= tag)
        selector - the DKIM selector (s= tag)

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the accumulated state for a new message.

        Call this between messages when reusing the validator.

      • evaluate

        public void evaluate​(java.lang.String fromDomain,
                     SPFResult spfResult,
                     java.lang.String spfDomain,
                     DKIMResult dkimResult,
                     java.lang.String dkimDomain,
                     DMARCCallback callback)
        Evaluates DMARC for a message.
        Parameters:
        fromDomain - the RFC5322.From domain
        spfResult - the SPF check result
        spfDomain - the domain checked by SPF (envelope sender domain)
        dkimResult - the DKIM verification result
        dkimDomain - the DKIM signing domain (d= tag)
        callback - the callback to receive the result
